item.title: Report X-2024070621
item.description:
Report X-2024070621

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKIING HAZMAT. DESIGNATE RESPONDER FOUND PACKAE ON THE FLOOR WITH A COUPLE OF THE CORNERS WET. WHEN PACKAGE WAS OPENED A SMALL AMOUNT OF FLUID WAS LEAKING FRON THE CLOSURE. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.

item.title: Report E-2024070162
item.description:
Report E-2024070162

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 27, 2024, one (1) 15-gallon pail of UN3266 was damaged due to unknown causes and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. After locating the damaged product, FCE wiped down the impacted pallet and floor. The absorbent rags, and damaged product were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024070101
item.description:
Report E-2024070101

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: ASHEVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Boasso
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE DRIVER WAS ENROUTE TO CONSIGNEE HE STOPPED AT REST AREA. INSPECTION OF VEHCILE SHOWED SLIGHT LEAK AT PRODUCT CAP ON BOTTOM. HE NOTICED PRODUCT HAD LEAKED FROM THE BOTTOM CONNECTION. CLOSURE RESEALED AND CAP WAS REPLACED. SPILL WAS CLEANED WITHOUT ANY FURTHER INCIDENT.

item.title: Report I-2024070001
item.description:
Report I-2024070001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the top side of the pail putting a 1.5 inch long puncture in the pail. Pail was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.
